page.title: 10FAUNA & FLORA OF GREETE CONT
page.content: Many of the hedgerows are several hundred years old, and where the hedge has been trimmed (rather than flailed), layed, or left to grow, there can be up to eighteen species of woody perennials on one farm, including oak, ash, wych elm, sycamore, field maple, crab apple, damson, bullace, elder, willow, hazel, blackthorn, rose, blackberry, and, on calcareous soils, dogwood. Climbing plants such as ivy, goosegrass, black bryony, and honeysuckle abound. There are many species of hedgerow flowers, in places in profusion, for example, cowslips, primroses, bluebells, violets, stitchworts,red campion,nightshades, wild strawberry, wild arum, sometimes early purple orchid, and occasionally spurge laurel. CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE
